intro: Arrabidaea cinerea var. longipila, commonly known as the long-stemmed ironwood, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its woody, branching stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is adapted to arid environments and has a slow growth rate, making it a long-lived species. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes.
